summary:
*Intention*: Implement per-entry JSON logging for version control
*Implementation*: Updated slack_notifier.py to write individual JSON files to .claude/query-logs/
*Changes*: `.claude/hooks/slack_notifier.py`, `.claude/query-logs/README.md`
*Next*: Logs will auto-populate on next Claude session completion [slack_notifier.py, README.md]
complete:
Done. Committed as `72fbb3fc5`.

## Files

| File | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| `.claude/hooks/slack_notifier.py` | The updated stop hook |
| `.claude/query-logs/README.md` | Documents the log format |

## What Changed

The hook now writes individual JSON files to `.claude/query-logs/`:

```
.claude/query-logs/
├── 20260204070000-DESKTOP-ABC123-72fbb3f.json
├── 20260204071500-LAPTOP-XYZ789-72fbb3f.json
└── README.md
```

Each file is uniquely named, so multiple machines will never conflict. Safe to `git add` and commit after each session.

~~~ FOR SLACK ~~~
